text: the villages like so many others across
Iraq the place of planting and
harvesting but Bashir has lost its
people now Kurdish snipers watch for the
Isis fighters who have taken over Bashir
this is the point at which the Kurdish
forces stopped the advance of Isis but
before they did the fundamentalists went
into the village behind us and massacred
people civilians killed solely on the
basis of their religion a healin Mardan
saw his 71 year old father Hamad gunned
down in front of him well take a look
what can I say I hope to fight them if I
saw one of them I would kill him with my
hands not just me but all of my people
and all the village the villagers now in
mourning were driven out once before in
Saddam Hussein's time the Iraq war of
2003 saw them regain their lands now
that dispossession has come again the
young men are flocking to take up arms
thousands have fled from areas where
Turkmen Shia once lived alongside Sunnis
we drove along the empty streets of
tazza the next village to Bashir they've
ended up in refugee camps the fate of
millions now across this region their
religious leaders have called for
resistance like this cleric whose
bleakly Frank about Iraq's crisis he
wouldn't give his name as he fears being
targeted by Isis do you realistically
think there will be peace in Iraq right
it is far away it is not impossible but
it needs time in Kirkuk we witnessed the
dynamic driving Iraq deeper into chaos a
suicide bomber tried to enter the market
in a Kurdish district and killed 5
people that got Summum fearing another
bomb police tried to drive the crowds
back a man was attacked by the crowd and
arrested this is the very frightened
aftermath of a suicide bombing people
here fear that Isis can strike again at
any minute and that's why the police are
so nervous that's why we've seen them
shooting into the air trying to drive
the crowds back that is the power of
Isis to spread terror Fergal keen BBC
News Kirkuk northern Iraq
[Music]
